sec.title: Cabot P.O.L. Cream
sec.p: Cabot P.O.L. Cream is formulated to deliver the proven benefits of phospholipids—powerful natural antioxidants and the chief moisturizing agent in the skin, which penetrate the skin to provide long-lasting moisturizing and protection—to provide safe and effective treatment and protection of dry, cracked skin. Phospholipids are the prime building blocks of all forms of life, and they are thus indispensable to all forms of life and healthy skin by assembling and strengthening skin cell membranes, stimulating microcirculation, and accelerating the natural healing of superficially and seriously traumatized skin. For more information, visit CabotSkinCare.com or call 800-645-5048.

sec.title: CalleX® Ointment for Dry, Cracked Feet
sec.p: Xenna Corporation’s diabetic-friendly NonyX® Nail Gel is sold in the foot care aisle of most pharmacies. Its patented exfoliating agent, ethanoic acid, gradually removes discoloring keratin debris, the buildup under toenails or fingernails that makes them appear yellow or dark. Twice-daily application on and under the nail results in clear, healthy-looking toenails in 5 to 9 months. Visit www.nonyx.com/resource for photos, research studies and samples. Xenna’s diabetic-friendly CalleX® Ointment for Dry, Cracked Feet is sold in the foot care aisle at Walgreen’s and Rite Aid. Highly moisturizing, CalleX is free of acids, parabens, lanolin, and preservatives. Its natural, patented enzymes gently remove dry skin and soften hardened areas on dry heels and soles without the need for scraping or scrubbing. The soft scent of natural peppermint oil also keeps feet smelling fresh with each application. Results are seen in 2 to 4 weeks. Visit www.callexointment.com/resource for photos, research studies, and samples or call 800-368-6003.

sec.title: Foot Solutions
sec.p: Foot Solutions is a concept that was developed to provide solutions for people with foot problems and hard-to-fit feet. We carry diabetic-appropriate shoes and inserts that can offload pressure areas. All of our stores have at least 1 board-certified pedorthist on staff to ensure that all physician prescriptions are filled promptly and correctly. We have the ability to modify both shoes and arch supports as prescribed by your physician. Our goal is to provide a correctly fitted shoe and arch support to help prevent diabetic foot problems. We have over 175 locations in the U.S., Canada, and worldwide. Go to footsolutions.com or call 1.800.FIT.FOOT to find a store near you.
